5183         assert_allclose(p, converter(tr, pr, 'less'), rtol=1e-14)
5184 
5185     with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_nd_omit):
5186         t, p = stats.ttest_rel(rvs1_2D, rvs2_2D, 0,
5187                                nan_policy='omit', alternative='greater')
5188     assert_allclose(t, tr, rtol=1e-14)
5189     with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'):
5190         assert_allclose(p, converter(tr, pr, 'greater'), rtol=1e-14)
5191 
5192 
5193 def test_ttest_rel_nan_2nd_arg():
5194     # regression test for gh-6134: nans in the second arg were not handled
5195     x = [np.nan, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0]
5196     y = [1.0, 2.0, 1.0, 2.0]
5197 
5198     r1 = stats.ttest_rel(x, y, nan_policy='omit')
5199     r2 = stats.ttest_rel(y, x, nan_policy='omit')
5200     assert_allclose(r2.statistic, -r1.statistic, atol=1e-15)
5201     assert_allclose(r2.pvalue, r1.pvalue, atol=1e-15)
5202 
5203     # NB: arguments are paired when NaNs are dropped
5204     r3 = stats.ttest_rel(y[1:], x[1:])
5205     assert_allclose(r2, r3, atol=1e-15)
5206 
5207     # .. and this is consistent with R. R code:
5208     # x = c(NA, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0)
5209     # y = c(1.0, 2.0, 1.0, 2.0)
5210     # t.test(x, y, paired=TRUE)
5211     assert_allclose(r2, (-2, 0.1835), atol=1e-4)
5212 
5213 
5214 def test_ttest_rel_empty_1d_returns_nan():
5215     # Two empty inputs should return a TtestResult containing nan
5216     # for both values.
5217     with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
5218         result = stats.ttest_rel([], [])
5219     assert isinstance(result, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
5220     assert_equal(result, (np.nan, np.nan))
5221 
5222 
5223 @pytest.mark.parametrize('b, expected_shape',
5224                          [(np.empty((1, 5, 0)), (3, 5)),
5225                           (np.empty((1, 0, 0)), (3, 0))])
5226 def test_ttest_rel_axis_size_zero(b, expected_shape):
5227     # In this test, the length of the axis dimension is zero.
5228     # The results should be arrays containing nan with shape
5229     # given by the broadcast nonaxis dimensions.
5230     a = np.empty((3, 1, 0))
5231     with np.testing.suppress_warnings() as sup:
5232         # first case should warn, second shouldn't?
5233         sup.filter(SmallSampleWarning, too_small_nd_not_omit)
5234         result = stats.ttest_rel(a, b, axis=-1)
5235     assert isinstance(result, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
5236     expected_value = np.full(expected_shape, fill_value=np.nan)
5237     assert_equal(result.statistic, expected_value)
5238     assert_equal(result.pvalue, expected_value)
5239 
5240 
5241 def test_ttest_rel_nonaxis_size_zero():
5242     # In this test, the length of the axis dimension is nonzero,
5243     # but one of the nonaxis dimensions has length 0.  Check that
5244     # we still get the correctly broadcast shape, which is (5, 0)
5245     # in this case.
5246     a = np.empty((1, 8, 0))
5247     b = np.empty((5, 8, 1))
5248     result = stats.ttest_rel(a, b, axis=1)
5249     assert isinstance(result, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
5250     assert_equal(result.statistic.shape, (5, 0))
5251     assert_equal(result.pvalue.shape, (5, 0))
5252 
5253 
5254 @pytest.mark.parametrize("alternative", ['two-sided', 'less', 'greater'])
5255 def test_ttest_rel_ci_1d(alternative):
5256     # test confidence interval method against reference values
5257     rng = np.random.default_rng(3749065329432213059)
5258     n = 10
5259     x = rng.normal(size=n, loc=1.5, scale=2)
5260     y = rng.normal(size=n, loc=2, scale=2)
5261     # Reference values generated with R t.test:
5262     # options(digits=16)
5263     # x = c(1.22825792,  1.63950485,  4.39025641,  0.68609437,  2.03813481,
5264     #       -1.20040109,  1.81997937,  1.86854636,  2.94694282,  3.94291373)
5265     # y = c(3.49961496, 1.53192536, 5.53620083, 2.91687718, 0.04858043,
5266     #       3.78505943, 3.3077496 , 2.30468892, 3.42168074, 0.56797592)
5267     # t.test(x, y, paired=TRUE, conf.level=0.85, alternative='l')
5268 
5269     ref = {'two-sided': [-1.912194489914035, 0.400169725914035],
5270            'greater': [-1.563944820311475, np.inf],
5271            'less': [-np.inf, 0.05192005631147523]}
5272     res = stats.ttest_rel(x, y, alternative=alternative)
5273     ci = res.confidence_interval(confidence_level=0.85)
5274     assert_allclose(ci, ref[alternative])
5275     assert_equal(res.df, n-1)
5276 
5277 
5278 @pytest.mark.parametrize("test_fun, args",
5279                          [(stats.ttest_1samp, (np.arange(10), 0)),
5280                           (stats.ttest_rel, (np.arange(10), np.arange(10)))])
5281 def test_ttest_ci_iv(test_fun, args):
5282     # test `confidence_interval` method input validation
5283     res = test_fun(*args)
5284     message = '`confidence_level` must be a number between 0 and 1.'
5285     with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
5286         res.confidence_interval(confidence_level=10)
5287 
5288 
5289 def _desc_stats(x1, x2, axis=0, *, xp=None):
5290     xp = array_namespace(x1, x2) if xp is None else xp
5291 
5292     def _stats(x, axis=0):
5293         x = xp.asarray(x)
5294         mu = xp.mean(x, axis=axis)
5295         std = xp.std(x, axis=axis, correction=1)
5296         nobs = x.shape[axis]
5297         return mu, std, nobs
5298 
5299     return _stats(x1, axis) + _stats(x2, axis)
5300 
5301 
5302 @array_api_compatible
5303 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
5304                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
5305 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
5306 def test_ttest_ind(xp):
5307     # regression test
5308     tr = xp.asarray(1.0912746897927283)
5309     pr = xp.asarray(0.27647818616351882)
5310     tr_2D = xp.asarray([tr, -tr])
5311     pr_2D = xp.asarray([pr, pr])
5312 
5313     rvs1 = xp.linspace(5, 105, 100)
5314     rvs2 = xp.linspace(1, 100, 100)
5315     rvs1_2D = xp.stack([rvs1, rvs2])
5316     rvs2_2D = xp.stack([rvs2, rvs1])
5317 
5318     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, axis=0)
5319     t, p = res  # check that result object can be unpacked
5320     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
5321     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
5322 
5323     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1, rvs2))
5324     t, p = res  # check that result object can be unpacked
5325     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
5326     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
5327 
5328     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T, axis=0)
5329     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
5330     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
5331 
5332     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T))
5333     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
5334     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
5335 
5336     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D, rvs2_2D, axis=1)
5337     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
5338     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
5339 
5340     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1_2D, rvs2_2D, axis=1))
5341     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
5342     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
5343 
5344     # test on 3 dimensions removed because generic tests in
5345     # test_axis_nan_policy are much stronger
5346 
5347     # test alternative parameter
5348     message = "`alternative` must be 'less', 'greater', or 'two-sided'."
5349     with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
5350         stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, alternative = "error")
5351 
5352     args = _desc_stats(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T)
5353     with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
5354         stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*args, alternative = "error")
5355 
5356     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, alternative="less")
5357     xp_assert_close(p, 1 - (pr/2))
5358     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
5359 
5360     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, alternative="greater")
5361     xp_assert_close(p, pr/2)
5362     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
5363 
5364     # Check that ttest_ind_from_stats agrees with ttest_ind
5365     res1 = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T, axis=0, alternative="less")
5366     args = _desc_stats(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T)
5367     res2 = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*args, alternative="less")
5368     xp_assert_close(res1.statistic, res2.statistic)
5369     xp_assert_close(res1.pvalue, res2.pvalue)
5370 
5371     res1 = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T, axis=0, alternative="less")
5372     args = _desc_stats(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T)
5373     res2 = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*args, alternative="less")
5374     xp_assert_close(res1.statistic, res2.statistic)
5375     xp_assert_close(res1.pvalue, res2.pvalue)
5376 
5377     # test NaNs
5378     NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
5379     rvs1 = xp.where(xp.arange(rvs1.shape[0]) == 0, NaN, rvs1)
5380 
5381     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, axis=0)
5382     xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
5383     xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
5384 
5385     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1, rvs2))
5386     xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
5387     xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
5388 
5389 
5390 def test_ttest_ind_nan_policy():
5391     rvs1 = np.linspace(5, 105, 100)
5392     rvs2 = np.linspace(1, 100, 100)
5393     rvs1_2D = np.array([rvs1, rvs2])
5394     rvs2_2D = np.array([rvs2, rvs1])
5395     rvs1_3D = np.dstack([rvs1_2D, rvs1_2D, rvs1_2D])
5396     rvs2_3D = np.dstack([rvs2_2D, rvs2_2D, rvs2_2D])
5397 
5398     # check nan policy
5399     rng = np.random.RandomState(12345678)
5400     x = stats.norm.rvs(loc=5, scale=10, size=501, random_state=rng)
5401     x[500] = np.nan
5402     y = stats.norm.rvs(loc=5, scale=10, size=500, random_state=rng)
5403 
5404     with np.errstate(invalid="ignore"):
5405         assert_array_equal(stats.ttest_ind(x, y), (np.nan, np.nan))
5406 
5407     assert_array_almost_equal(stats.ttest_ind(x, y, nan_policy='omit'),
5408                               (0.24779670949091914, 0.80434267337517906))
5409     assert_raises(ValueError, stats.ttest_ind, x, y, nan_policy='raise')
5410     assert_raises(ValueError, stats.ttest_ind, x, y, nan_policy='foobar')
5411 
5412     # test zero division problem
5413     with pytest.warns(RuntimeWarning, match="Precision loss occurred"):
5414         t, p = stats.ttest_ind([0, 0, 0], [1, 1, 1])
5415     assert_equal((np.abs(t), p), (np.inf, 0))
5416 
5417     with np.errstate(invalid="ignore"):
5418         assert_equal(stats.ttest_ind([0, 0, 0], [0, 0, 0]), (np.nan, np.nan))
5419 
5420         # check that nan in input array result in nan output
5421         anan = np.array([[1, np.nan], [-1, 1]])
5422         assert_equal(stats.ttest_ind(anan, np.zeros((2, 2))),
5423                      ([0, np.nan], [1, np.nan]))
5424 
5425     rvs1_3D[:, :, 10:15] = np.nan
5426     rvs2_3D[:, :, 6:12] = np.nan
5427 
5428     # Convert from two-sided p-values to one sided using T result data.
5429     def convert(t, p, alt):
5430         if (t < 0 and alt == "less") or (t > 0 and alt == "greater"):
5431             return p / 2
5432         return 1 - (p / 2)
5433     converter = np.vectorize(convert)
5434 
5435     tr, pr = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_3D, rvs2_3D, axis=0, nan_policy='omit')
5436 
5437     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_3D, rvs2_3D, axis=0, nan_policy='omit',
5438                            alternative='less')
5439     assert_allclose(t, tr, rtol=1e-14)
5440     assert_allclose(p, converter(tr, pr, 'less'), rtol=1e-14)
5441 
5442     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_3D, rvs2_3D, axis=0, nan_policy='omit',
5443                            alternative='greater')
5444     assert_allclose(t, tr, rtol=1e-14)
5445     assert_allclose(p, converter(tr, pr, 'greater'), rtol=1e-14)
5446 
5447 
5448 def test_ttest_ind_scalar():
5449     # test scalars
5450     with suppress_warnings() as sup, np.errstate(invalid="ignore"):
5451         sup.filter(RuntimeWarning, "Degrees of freedom <= 0 for slice")
5452         t, p = stats.ttest_ind(4., 3.)
5453     assert np.isnan(t)
5454     assert np.isnan(p)
5455 
5456 
5457 @pytest.mark.filterwarnings("ignore:Arguments...:DeprecationWarning")
5458 class Test_ttest_ind_permutations:
5459     N = 20
5460 
5461     # data for most tests
5462     np.random.seed(0)
5463     a = np.vstack((np.arange(3*N//4), np.random.random(3*N//4)))
5464     b = np.vstack((np.arange(N//4) + 100, np.random.random(N//4)))
5465 
5466     # data for equal variance tests
5467     a2 = np.arange(10)
5468     b2 = np.arange(10) + 100
5469 
5470     # data for exact test
5471     a3 = [1, 2]
5472     b3 = [3, 4]
5473 
5474     # data for bigger test
5475     np.random.seed(0)
5476     rvs1 = stats.norm.rvs(loc=5, scale=10,  # type: ignore
5477                           size=500).reshape(100, 5).T
5478     rvs2 = stats.norm.rvs(loc=8, scale=20, size=100)  # type: ignore
5479 
5480     p_d = [1/1001, (676+1)/1001]  # desired pvalues
5481     p_d_gen = [1/1001, (672 + 1)/1001]  # desired pvalues for Generator seed
5482     p_d_big = [(993+1)/1001, (685+1)/1001, (840+1)/1001,
5483                (955+1)/1001, (255+1)/1001]
5484 
5485     params = [
5486         (a, b, {"axis": 1}, p_d),                     # basic test
5487         (a.T, b.T, {'axis': 0}, p_d),                 # along axis 0
5488         (a[0, :], b[0, :], {'axis': None}, p_d[0]),   # 1d data
5489         (a[0, :].tolist(), b[0, :].tolist(), {'axis': None}, p_d[0]),
5490         # different seeds
5491         (a, b, {'random_state': 0, "axis": 1}, p_d),
5492         (a, b, {'random_state': np.random.RandomState(0), "axis": 1}, p_d),
5493         (a2, b2, {'equal_var': True}, 1/1001),  # equal variances
5494         (rvs1, rvs2, {'axis': -1, 'random_state': 0}, p_d_big),  # bigger test
5495         (a3, b3, {}, 1/3),  # exact test
5496         (a, b, {'random_state': np.random.default_rng(0), "axis": 1}, p_d_gen),
5497         ]
5498 
5499     @pytest.mark.parametrize("a,b,update,p_d", params)
5500     def test_ttest_ind_permutations(self, a, b, update, p_d):
5501         options_a = {'axis': None, 'equal_var': False}
5502         options_p = {'axis': None, 'equal_var': False,
5503                      'permutations': 1000, 'random_state': 0}
5504         options_a.update(update)
5505         options_p.update(update)
5506 
5507         stat_a, _ = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_a)
5508         stat_p, pvalue = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5509         assert_array_almost_equal(stat_a, stat_p, 5)
5510         assert_array_almost_equal(pvalue, p_d)
5511 
5512     def test_ttest_ind_exact_alternative(self):
5513         np.random.seed(0)
5514         N = 3
5515         a = np.random.rand(2, N, 2)
5516         b = np.random.rand(2, N, 2)
5517 
5518         options_p = {'axis': 1, 'permutations': 1000}
5519 
5520         options_p.update(alternative="greater")
5521         res_g_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5522         res_g_ba = stats.ttest_ind(b, a, **options_p)
5523 
5524         options_p.update(alternative="less")
5525         res_l_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5526         res_l_ba = stats.ttest_ind(b, a, **options_p)
5527 
5528         options_p.update(alternative="two-sided")
5529         res_2_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5530         res_2_ba = stats.ttest_ind(b, a, **options_p)
5531 
5532         # Alternative doesn't affect the statistic
5533         assert_equal(res_g_ab.statistic, res_l_ab.statistic)
5534         assert_equal(res_g_ab.statistic, res_2_ab.statistic)
5535 
5536         # Reversing order of inputs negates statistic
5537         assert_equal(res_g_ab.statistic, -res_g_ba.statistic)
5538         assert_equal(res_l_ab.statistic, -res_l_ba.statistic)
5539         assert_equal(res_2_ab.statistic, -res_2_ba.statistic)
5540 
5541         # Reversing order of inputs does not affect p-value of 2-sided test
5542         assert_equal(res_2_ab.pvalue, res_2_ba.pvalue)
5543 
5544         # In exact test, distribution is perfectly symmetric, so these
5545         # identities are exactly satisfied.
5546         assert_equal(res_g_ab.pvalue, res_l_ba.pvalue)
5547         assert_equal(res_l_ab.pvalue, res_g_ba.pvalue)
5548         mask = res_g_ab.pvalue <= 0.5
5549         assert_equal(res_g_ab.pvalue[mask] + res_l_ba.pvalue[mask],
5550                      res_2_ab.pvalue[mask])
5551         assert_equal(res_l_ab.pvalue[~mask] + res_g_ba.pvalue[~mask],
5552                      res_2_ab.pvalue[~mask])
5553 
5554     def test_ttest_ind_exact_selection(self):
5555         # test the various ways of activating the exact test
5556         np.random.seed(0)
5557         N = 3
5558         a = np.random.rand(N)
5559         b = np.random.rand(N)
5560         res0 = stats.ttest_ind(a, b)
5561         res1 = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, permutations=1000)
5562         res2 = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, permutations=0)
5563         res3 = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, permutations=np.inf)
5564         assert res1.pvalue != res0.pvalue
5565         assert res2.pvalue == res0.pvalue
5566         assert res3.pvalue == res1.pvalue
5567 
5568     def test_ttest_ind_exact_distribution(self):
5569         # the exact distribution of the test statistic should have
5570         # binom(na + nb, na) elements, all unique. This was not always true
5571         # in gh-4824; fixed by gh-13661.
5572         np.random.seed(0)
5573         a = np.random.rand(3)
5574         b = np.random.rand(4)
5575 
5576         data = np.concatenate((a, b))
5577         na, nb = len(a), len(b)
5578 
5579         permutations = 100000
5580         t_stat, _, _ = _permutation_distribution_t(data, permutations, na,
5581                                                    True)
5582 
5583         n_unique = len(set(t_stat))
5584         assert n_unique == binom(na + nb, na)
5585         assert len(t_stat) == n_unique
5586 
5587     def test_ttest_ind_randperm_alternative(self):
5588         np.random.seed(0)
5589         N = 50
5590         a = np.random.rand(2, 3, N)
5591         b = np.random.rand(3, N)
5592         options_p = {'axis': -1, 'permutations': 1000, "random_state": 0}
5593 
5594         options_p.update(alternative="greater")
5595         res_g_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5596         res_g_ba = stats.ttest_ind(b, a, **options_p)
5597 
5598         options_p.update(alternative="less")
5599         res_l_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5600         res_l_ba = stats.ttest_ind(b, a, **options_p)
5601 
5602         # Alternative doesn't affect the statistic
5603         assert_equal(res_g_ab.statistic, res_l_ab.statistic)
5604 
5605         # Reversing order of inputs negates statistic
5606         assert_equal(res_g_ab.statistic, -res_g_ba.statistic)
5607         assert_equal(res_l_ab.statistic, -res_l_ba.statistic)
5608 
5609         # For random permutations, the chance of ties between the observed
5610         # test statistic and the population is small, so:
5611         assert_equal(res_g_ab.pvalue + res_l_ab.pvalue,
5612                      1 + 1/(options_p['permutations'] + 1))
5613         assert_equal(res_g_ba.pvalue + res_l_ba.pvalue,
5614                      1 + 1/(options_p['permutations'] + 1))
5615 
5616     @pytest.mark.slow()
5617     def test_ttest_ind_randperm_alternative2(self):
5618         np.random.seed(0)
5619         N = 50
5620         a = np.random.rand(N, 4)
5621         b = np.random.rand(N, 4)
5622         options_p = {'permutations': 20000, "random_state": 0}
5623 
5624         options_p.update(alternative="greater")
5625         res_g_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5626 
5627         options_p.update(alternative="less")
5628         res_l_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5629 
5630         options_p.update(alternative="two-sided")
5631         res_2_ab = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5632 
5633         # For random permutations, the chance of ties between the observed
5634         # test statistic and the population is small, so:
5635         assert_equal(res_g_ab.pvalue + res_l_ab.pvalue,
5636                      1 + 1/(options_p['permutations'] + 1))
5637 
5638         # For for large sample sizes, the distribution should be approximately
5639         # symmetric, so these identities should be approximately satisfied
5640         mask = res_g_ab.pvalue <= 0.5
5641         assert_allclose(2 * res_g_ab.pvalue[mask],
5642                         res_2_ab.pvalue[mask], atol=2e-2)
5643         assert_allclose(2 * (1-res_g_ab.pvalue[~mask]),
5644                         res_2_ab.pvalue[~mask], atol=2e-2)
5645         assert_allclose(2 * res_l_ab.pvalue[~mask],
5646                         res_2_ab.pvalue[~mask], atol=2e-2)
5647         assert_allclose(2 * (1-res_l_ab.pvalue[mask]),
5648                         res_2_ab.pvalue[mask], atol=2e-2)
5649 
5650     def test_ttest_ind_permutation_nanpolicy(self):
5651         np.random.seed(0)
5652         N = 50
5653         a = np.random.rand(N, 5)
5654         b = np.random.rand(N, 5)
5655         a[5, 1] = np.nan
5656         b[8, 2] = np.nan
5657         a[9, 3] = np.nan
5658         b[9, 3] = np.nan
5659         options_p = {'permutations': 1000, "random_state": 0}
5660 
5661         # Raise
5662         options_p.update(nan_policy="raise")
5663         with assert_raises(ValueError, match="The input contains nan values"):
5664             res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5665 
5666         # Propagate
5667         with suppress_warnings() as sup:
5668             sup.record(RuntimeWarning, "invalid value*")
5669             options_p.update(nan_policy="propagate")
5670             res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, **options_p)
5671 
5672             mask = np.isnan(a).any(axis=0) | np.isnan(b).any(axis=0)
5673             res2 = stats.ttest_ind(a[:, ~mask], b[:, ~mask], **options_p)
5674 
5675             assert_equal(res.pvalue[mask], np.nan)
5676             assert_equal(res.statistic[mask], np.nan)
5677 
5678             assert_allclose(res.pvalue[~mask], res2.pvalue)
5679             assert_allclose(res.statistic[~mask], res2.statistic)
5680 
5681             # Propagate 1d
5682             res = stats.ttest_ind(a.ravel(), b.ravel(), **options_p)
5683             assert np.isnan(res.pvalue)  # assert makes sure it's a scalar
5684             assert np.isnan(res.statistic)
5685 
5686     def test_ttest_ind_permutation_check_inputs(self):
5687         with assert_raises(ValueError, match="Permutations must be"):
5688             stats.ttest_ind(self.a2, self.b2, permutations=-3)
5689         with assert_raises(ValueError, match="Permutations must be"):
5690             stats.ttest_ind(self.a2, self.b2, permutations=1.5)
5691         with assert_raises(ValueError, match="'hello' cannot be used"):
5692             stats.ttest_ind(self.a, self.b, permutations=1,
5693                             random_state='hello', axis=1)
5694 
5695     def test_ttest_ind_permutation_check_p_values(self):
5696         # p-values should never be exactly zero
5697         N = 10
5698         a = np.random.rand(N, 20)
5699         b = np.random.rand(N, 20)
5700         p_values = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, permutations=1).pvalue
5701         print(0.0 not in p_values)
5702         assert 0.0 not in p_values
5703 
5704     @pytest.mark.parametrize("alternative", ['less', 'greater', 'two-sided'])
5705     @pytest.mark.parametrize("shape", [(12,), (2, 12)])
5706     def test_permutation_method(self, alternative, shape):
5707         rng = np.random.default_rng(2348934579834565)
5708         x = rng.random(size=shape)
5709         y = rng.random(size=13)
5710 
5711         kwargs = dict(n_resamples=999)
5712 
5713         # Use ttest_ind with `method`
5714         rng = np.random.default_rng(348934579834565)
5715         method = stats.PermutationMethod(rng=rng, **kwargs)
5716         res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=-1, alternative=alternative, method=method)
5717 
5718         # Use `permutation_test` directly
5719         def statistic(x, y, axis): return stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=axis).statistic
5720         rng =  np.random.default_rng(348934579834565)
5721         ref = stats.permutation_test((x, y), statistic, axis=-1, rng=rng,
5722                                      alternative=alternative, **kwargs)
5723 
5724         assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
5725         assert_equal(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue)
5726 
5727         # Sanity check against theoretical t-test
5728         ref = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=-1, alternative=alternative)
5729         assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
5730         assert_allclose(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue, rtol=3e-2)
5731 
5732     @pytest.mark.parametrize("alternative", ['less', 'greater', 'two-sided'])
5733     @pytest.mark.parametrize("shape", [(12,), (2, 12)])
5734     def test_monte_carlo_method(self, alternative, shape):
5735         rng = np.random.default_rng(2348934579834565)
5736         x = rng.random(size=shape)
5737         y = rng.random(size=13)
5738 
5739         kwargs = dict(n_resamples=999)
5740 
5741         # Use `monte_carlo` directly
5742         def statistic(x, y, axis): return stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=axis).statistic
5743         rng = np.random.default_rng(348934579834565)
5744         rvs = [rng.standard_normal, rng.standard_normal]
5745         ref = stats.monte_carlo_test((x, y), rvs=rvs, statistic=statistic, axis=-1,
5746                                      alternative=alternative, **kwargs)
5747 
5748         # Use ttest_ind with `method`
5749         rng = np.random.default_rng(348934579834565)
5750         rvs = [rng.standard_normal, rng.standard_normal]
5751         method = stats.MonteCarloMethod(rvs=rvs, **kwargs)
5752         res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=-1, alternative=alternative, method=method)
5753         assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
5754         assert_equal(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue)
5755 
5756         # Passing `rng` instead of `rvs`
5757         method = stats.MonteCarloMethod(rng=348934579834565, **kwargs)
5758         res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=-1, alternative=alternative, method=method)
5759         assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
5760         assert_equal(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue)
5761 
5762         # Sanity check against theoretical t-test
5763         ref = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, axis=-1, alternative=alternative)
5764         assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
5765         assert_allclose(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue, rtol=6e-2)
5766 
5767     def test_resampling_input_validation(self):
5768         message = "`method` must be an instance of `PermutationMethod`, an instance..."
5769         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
5770             stats.ttest_ind([1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], method='migratory')
5771 
5772     @array_api_compatible
5773     @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
5774                                   reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
5775     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
5776     def test_permutation_not_implement_for_xp(self, xp):
5777         a2, b2 = xp.asarray(self.a2), xp.asarray(self.b2)
5778 
5779         message = "Use of `permutations` is compatible only with NumPy arrays."
5780         if is_numpy(xp):  # no error
5781             stats.ttest_ind(a2, b2, permutations=10)
5782         else:  # NotImplementedError
5783             with pytest.raises(NotImplementedError, match=message):
5784                 stats.ttest_ind(a2, b2, permutations=10)
5785 
5786         message = "Use of resampling methods is compatible only with NumPy arrays."
5787         rng = np.random.default_rng(7457345872572348)
5788         method = stats.PermutationMethod(rng=rng)
5789         if is_numpy(xp):  # no error
5790             stats.ttest_ind(a2, b2, method=method)
5791         else:  # NotImplementedError
5792             with pytest.raises(NotImplementedError, match=message):
5793                 stats.ttest_ind(a2, b2, method=method)
5794 
5795 
5796 @pytest.mark.filterwarnings("ignore:Arguments...:DeprecationWarning")
5797 class Test_ttest_ind_common:
5798     # for tests that are performed on variations of the t-test such as
5799     # permutations and trimming
5800     @pytest.mark.xslow()
5801     @pytest.mark.parametrize("kwds", [{'permutations': 200, 'random_state': 0},
5802                                       {'trim': .2}, {}],
5803                              ids=["permutations", "trim", "basic"])
5804     @pytest.mark.parametrize('equal_var', [True, False],
5805                              ids=['equal_var', 'unequal_var'])
5806     def test_ttest_many_dims(self, kwds, equal_var):
5807         # Test that test works on many-dimensional arrays
5808         np.random.seed(0)
5809         a = np.random.rand(5, 4, 4, 7, 1, 6)
5810         b = np.random.rand(4, 1, 8, 2, 6)
5811         res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, axis=-3, **kwds)
5812 
5813         # compare fully-vectorized t-test against t-test on smaller slice
5814         i, j, k = 2, 3, 1
5815         a2 = a[i, :, j, :, 0, :]
5816         b2 = b[:, 0, :, k, :]
5817         res2 = stats.ttest_ind(a2, b2, axis=-2, **kwds)
5818         assert_equal(res.statistic[i, :, j, k, :],
5819                      res2.statistic)
5820         assert_equal(res.pvalue[i, :, j, k, :],
5821                      res2.pvalue)
5822 
5823         # compare against t-test on one axis-slice at a time
5824 
5825         # manually broadcast with tile; move axis to end to simplify
5826         x = np.moveaxis(np.tile(a, (1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1)), -3, -1)
5827         y = np.moveaxis(np.tile(b, (5, 1, 4, 1, 1, 1)), -3, -1)
5828         shape = x.shape[:-1]
5829         statistics = np.zeros(shape)
5830         pvalues = np.zeros(shape)
5831         for indices in product(*(range(i) for i in shape)):
5832             xi = x[indices]  # use tuple to index single axis slice
5833             yi = y[indices]
5834             res3 = stats.ttest_ind(xi, yi, axis=-1, **kwds)
5835             statistics[indices] = res3.statistic
5836             pvalues[indices] = res3.pvalue
5837 
5838         assert_allclose(statistics, res.statistic)
5839         assert_allclose(pvalues, res.pvalue)
5840 
5841     @pytest.mark.parametrize("kwds", [{'permutations': 200, 'random_state': 0},
5842                                       {'trim': .2}, {}],
5843                              ids=["trim", "permutations", "basic"])
5844     @pytest.mark.parametrize("axis", [-1, 0])
5845     def test_nans_on_axis(self, kwds, axis):
5846         # confirm that with `nan_policy='propagate'`, NaN results are returned
5847         # on the correct location
5848         a = np.random.randint(10, size=(5, 3, 10)).astype('float')
5849         b = np.random.randint(10, size=(5, 3, 10)).astype('float')
5850         # set some indices in `a` and `b` to be `np.nan`.
5851         a[0][2][3] = np.nan
5852         b[2][0][6] = np.nan
5853 
5854         # arbitrarily use `np.sum` as a baseline for which indices should be
5855         # NaNs
5856         expected = np.isnan(np.sum(a + b, axis=axis))
5857         # multidimensional inputs to `t.sf(np.abs(t), df)` with NaNs on some
5858         # indices throws an warning. See issue gh-13844
5859         with suppress_warnings() as sup, np.errstate(invalid="ignore"):
5860             sup.filter(RuntimeWarning,
5861                        "invalid value encountered in less_equal")
5862             sup.filter(RuntimeWarning, "Precision loss occurred")
5863             res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, axis=axis, **kwds)
5864         p_nans = np.isnan(res.pvalue)
5865         assert_array_equal(p_nans, expected)
5866         statistic_nans = np.isnan(res.statistic)
5867         assert_array_equal(statistic_nans, expected)
5868 
5869 
5870 class Test_ttest_trim:
5871     params = [
5872         [[1, 2, 3], [1.1, 2.9, 4.2], 0.53619490753126731, -0.6864951273557258,
5873          .2],
5874         [[56, 128.6, 12, 123.8, 64.34, 78, 763.3], [1.1, 2.9, 4.2],
5875          0.00998909252078421, 4.591598691181999, .2],
5876         [[56, 128.6, 12, 123.8, 64.34, 78, 763.3], [1.1, 2.9, 4.2],
5877          0.10512380092302633, 2.832256715395378, .32],
5878         [[2.7, 2.7, 1.1, 3.0, 1.9, 3.0, 3.8, 3.8, 0.3, 1.9, 1.9],
5879          [6.5, 5.4, 8.1, 3.5, 0.5, 3.8, 6.8, 4.9, 9.5, 6.2, 4.1],
5880          0.002878909511344, -4.2461168970325, .2],
5881         [[-0.84504783, 0.13366078, 3.53601757, -0.62908581, 0.54119466,
5882           -1.16511574, -0.08836614, 1.18495416, 2.48028757, -1.58925028,
5883           -1.6706357, 0.3090472, -2.12258305, 0.3697304, -1.0415207,
5884           -0.57783497, -0.90997008, 1.09850192, 0.41270579, -1.4927376],
5885          [1.2725522, 1.1657899, 2.7509041, 1.2389013, -0.9490494, -1.0752459,
5886           1.1038576, 2.9912821, 3.5349111, 0.4171922, 1.0168959, -0.7625041,
5887           -0.4300008, 3.0431921, 1.6035947, 0.5285634, -0.7649405, 1.5575896,
5888           1.3670797, 1.1726023], 0.005293305834235, -3.0983317739483, .2]]
5889 
5890     @pytest.mark.parametrize("a,b,pr,tr,trim", params)
5891     def test_ttest_compare_r(self, a, b, pr, tr, trim):
5892         ''' 
5893         Using PairedData's yuen.t.test method. Something to note is that there 
5894         are at least 3 R packages that come with a trimmed t-test method, and 
5895         comparisons were made between them. It was found that PairedData's 
5896         method's results match this method, SAS, and one of the other R 
5897         methods. A notable discrepancy was the DescTools implementation of the 
5898         function, which only sometimes agreed with SAS, WRS2, PairedData and 
5899         this implementation. For this reason, most comparisons in R are made 
5900         against PairedData's method. 
5901  
5902         Rather than providing the input and output for all evaluations, here is 
5903         a representative example: 
5904         > library(PairedData) 
5905         > a <- c(1, 2, 3) 
5906         > b <- c(1.1, 2.9, 4.2) 
5907         > options(digits=16) 
5908         > yuen.t.test(a, b, tr=.2) 
5909  
5910             Two-sample Yuen test, trim=0.2 
5911  
5912         data:  x and y 
5913         t = -0.68649512735573, df = 3.4104431643464, p-value = 0.5361949075313 
5914         alternative hypothesis: true difference in trimmed means is not equal 
5915         to 0 
5916         95 percent confidence interval: 
5917          -3.912777195645217  2.446110528978550 
5918         sample estimates: 
5919         trimmed mean of x trimmed mean of y 
5920         2.000000000000000 2.73333333333333 
5921         '''
5922         statistic, pvalue = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=trim, equal_var=False)
5923         assert_allclose(statistic, tr, atol=1e-15)
5924         assert_allclose(pvalue, pr, atol=1e-15)
5925 
5926     def test_compare_SAS(self):
5927         # Source of the data used in this test:
5928         # https://support.sas.com/resources/papers/proceedings14/1660-2014.pdf
5929         a = [12, 14, 18, 25, 32, 44, 12, 14, 18, 25, 32, 44]
5930         b = [17, 22, 14, 12, 30, 29, 19, 17, 22, 14, 12, 30, 29, 19]
5931         # In this paper, a trimming percentage of 5% is used. However,
5932         # in their implementation, the number of values trimmed is rounded to
5933         # the nearest whole number. However, consistent with
5934         # `scipy.stats.trimmed_mean`, this test truncates to the lower
5935         # whole number. In this example, the paper notes that 1 value is
5936         # trimmed off of each side. 9% replicates this amount of trimming.
5937         statistic, pvalue = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=.09, equal_var=False)
5938         assert_allclose(pvalue, 0.514522, atol=1e-6)
5939         assert_allclose(statistic, 0.669169, atol=1e-6)
5940 
5941     def test_equal_var(self):
5942         ''' 
5943         The PairedData library only supports unequal variances. To compare 
5944         samples with equal variances, the multicon library is used. 
5945         > library(multicon) 
5946         > a <- c(2.7, 2.7, 1.1, 3.0, 1.9, 3.0, 3.8, 3.8, 0.3, 1.9, 1.9) 
5947         > b <- c(6.5, 5.4, 8.1, 3.5, 0.5, 3.8, 6.8, 4.9, 9.5, 6.2, 4.1) 
5948         > dv = c(a,b) 
5949         > iv = c(rep('a', length(a)), rep('b', length(b))) 
5950         > yuenContrast(dv~ iv, EQVAR = TRUE) 
5951         $Ms 
5952            N                 M wgt 
5953         a 11 2.442857142857143   1 
5954         b 11 5.385714285714286  -1 
5955  
5956         $test 
5957                               stat df              crit                   p 
5958         results -4.246116897032513 12 2.178812829667228 0.00113508833897713 
5959         '''
5960         a = [2.7, 2.7, 1.1, 3.0, 1.9, 3.0, 3.8, 3.8, 0.3, 1.9, 1.9]
5961         b = [6.5, 5.4, 8.1, 3.5, 0.5, 3.8, 6.8, 4.9, 9.5, 6.2, 4.1]
5962         # `equal_var=True` is default
5963         statistic, pvalue = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=.2)
5964         assert_allclose(pvalue, 0.00113508833897713, atol=1e-10)
5965         assert_allclose(statistic, -4.246116897032513, atol=1e-10)
5966 
5967     @pytest.mark.parametrize('alt,pr,tr',
5968                              (('greater', 0.9985605452443, -4.2461168970325),
5969                               ('less', 0.001439454755672, -4.2461168970325),),
5970                              )
5971     def test_alternatives(self, alt, pr, tr):
5972         ''' 
5973         > library(PairedData) 
5974         > a <- c(2.7,2.7,1.1,3.0,1.9,3.0,3.8,3.8,0.3,1.9,1.9) 
5975         > b <- c(6.5,5.4,8.1,3.5,0.5,3.8,6.8,4.9,9.5,6.2,4.1) 
5976         > options(digits=16) 
5977         > yuen.t.test(a, b, alternative = 'greater') 
5978         '''
5979         a = [2.7, 2.7, 1.1, 3.0, 1.9, 3.0, 3.8, 3.8, 0.3, 1.9, 1.9]
5980         b = [6.5, 5.4, 8.1, 3.5, 0.5, 3.8, 6.8, 4.9, 9.5, 6.2, 4.1]
5981 
5982         statistic, pvalue = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=.2, equal_var=False,
5983                                             alternative=alt)
5984         assert_allclose(pvalue, pr, atol=1e-10)
5985         assert_allclose(statistic, tr, atol=1e-10)
5986 
5987     def test_errors_unsupported(self):
5988         # confirm that attempting to trim with permutations raises an error
5989         match = "Use of `permutations` is incompatible with with use of `trim`."
5990         with assert_raises(NotImplementedError, match=match):
5991             message = "Arguments {'permutations'} are deprecated, whether..."
5992             with pytest.warns(DeprecationWarning, match=message):
5993                 stats.ttest_ind([1, 2], [2, 3], trim=.2, permutations=2)
5994 
5995         with assert_raises(NotImplementedError, match=match):
5996             message = "Arguments {.*'random_state'.*} are deprecated, whether..."
5997             with pytest.warns(DeprecationWarning, match=message):
5998                 stats.ttest_ind([1, 2], [2, 3], trim=.2, permutations=2,
5999                                 random_state=2)
6000 
6001     @array_api_compatible
6002     @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6003                                   reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6004     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6005     def test_permutation_not_implement_for_xp(self, xp):
6006         message = "Use of `trim` is compatible only with NumPy arrays."
6007         a, b = xp.arange(10), xp.arange(10)+1
6008         if is_numpy(xp):  # no error
6009             stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=0.1)
6010         else:  # NotImplementedError
6011             with pytest.raises(NotImplementedError, match=message):
6012                 stats.ttest_ind(a, b, trim=0.1)
6013 
6014     @pytest.mark.parametrize("trim", [-.2, .5, 1])
6015     def test_trim_bounds_error(self, trim):
6016         match = "Trimming percentage should be 0 <= `trim` < .5."
6017         with assert_raises(ValueError, match=match):
6018             stats.ttest_ind([1, 2], [2, 1], trim=trim)
6019 
6020 
6021 @array_api_compatible
6022 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6023                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6024 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6025 class Test_ttest_CI:
6026     # indices in order [alternative={two-sided, less, greater},
6027     #                   equal_var={False, True}, trim={0, 0.2}]
6028     # reference values in order `statistic, df, pvalue, low, high`
6029     # equal_var=False reference values computed with R PairedData yuen.t.test:
6030     #
6031     # library(PairedData)
6032     # options(digits=16)
6033     # a < - c(0.88236329, 0.97318744, 0.4549262, 0.97893335, 0.0606677,
6034     #         0.44013366, 0.55806018, 0.40151434, 0.14453315, 0.25860601,
6035     #         0.20202162)
6036     # b < - c(0.93455277, 0.42680603, 0.49751939, 0.14152846, 0.711435,
6037     #         0.77669667, 0.20507578, 0.78702772, 0.94691855, 0.32464958,
6038     #         0.3873582, 0.35187468, 0.21731811)
6039     # yuen.t.test(a, b, tr=0, conf.level = 0.9, alternative = 'l')
6040     #
6041     # equal_var=True reference values computed with R multicon yuenContrast:
6042     #
6043     # library(multicon)
6044     # options(digits=16)
6045     # a < - c(0.88236329, 0.97318744, 0.4549262, 0.97893335, 0.0606677,
6046     #         0.44013366, 0.55806018, 0.40151434, 0.14453315, 0.25860601,
6047     #         0.20202162)
6048     # b < - c(0.93455277, 0.42680603, 0.49751939, 0.14152846, 0.711435,
6049     #         0.77669667, 0.20507578, 0.78702772, 0.94691855, 0.32464958,
6050     #         0.3873582, 0.35187468, 0.21731811)
6051     # dv = c(a, b)
6052     # iv = c(rep('a', length(a)), rep('b', length(b)))
6053     # yuenContrast(dv~iv, EQVAR = FALSE, alternative = 'unequal', tr = 0.2)
6054     r = np.empty(shape=(3, 2, 2, 5))
6055     r[0, 0, 0] = [-0.2314607, 19.894435, 0.8193209, -0.247220294, 0.188729943]
6056     r[1, 0, 0] = [-0.2314607, 19.894435, 0.40966045, -np.inf, 0.1382426469]
6057     r[2, 0, 0] = [-0.2314607, 19.894435, 0.5903395, -0.1967329982, np.inf]
6058     r[0, 0, 1] = [-0.2452886, 11.427896, 0.8105823, -0.34057446, 0.25847383]
6059     r[1, 0, 1] = [-0.2452886, 11.427896, 0.40529115, -np.inf, 0.1865829074]
6060     r[2, 0, 1] = [-0.2452886, 11.427896, 0.5947089, -0.268683541, np.inf]
6061     # confidence interval not available for equal_var=True
6062     r[0, 1, 0] = [-0.2345625322555006, 22, 0.8167175905643815, np.nan, np.nan]
6063     r[1, 1, 0] = [-0.2345625322555006, 22, 0.4083587952821908, np.nan, np.nan]
6064     r[2, 1, 0] = [-0.2345625322555006, 22, 0.5916412047178092, np.nan, np.nan]
6065     r[0, 1, 1] = [-0.2505369406507428, 14, 0.8058115135702835, np.nan, np.nan]
6066     r[1, 1, 1] = [-0.2505369406507428, 14, 0.4029057567851417, np.nan, np.nan]
6067     r[2, 1, 1] = [-0.2505369406507428, 14, 0.5970942432148583, np.nan, np.nan]
6068     @pytest.mark.parametrize('alternative', ['two-sided', 'less', 'greater'])
6069     @pytest.mark.parametrize('equal_var', [False, True])
6070     @pytest.mark.parametrize('trim', [0, 0.2])
6071     def test_confidence_interval(self, alternative, equal_var, trim, xp):
6072         if equal_var and trim:
6073             pytest.xfail('Discrepancy in `main`; needs further investigation.')
6074 
6075         if trim and not is_numpy(xp):
6076             pytest.skip('`trim` is only compatible with NumPy input')
6077 
6078         rng = np.random.default_rng(3810954496107292580)
6079         x = xp.asarray(rng.random(11))
6080         y = xp.asarray(rng.random(13))
6081 
6082         res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, alternative=alternative,
6083                               equal_var=equal_var, trim=trim)
6084 
6085         alternatives = {'two-sided': 0, 'less': 1, 'greater': 2}
6086         ref = self.r[alternatives[alternative], int(equal_var), int(np.ceil(trim))]
6087         statistic, df, pvalue, low, high = ref
6088 
6089         rtol = 1e-7  # only 7 digits in reference
6090         xp_assert_close(res.statistic, xp.asarray(statistic), rtol=rtol)
6091         xp_assert_close(res.df, xp.asarray(df), rtol=rtol)
6092         xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, xp.asarray(pvalue), rtol=rtol)
6093 
6094         if not equal_var:  # CI not available when `equal_var is True`
6095             ci = res.confidence_interval(0.9)
6096             xp_assert_close(ci.low, xp.asarray(low), rtol=rtol)
6097             xp_assert_close(ci.high, xp.asarray(high), rtol=rtol)
6098 
6099 
6100 def test__broadcast_concatenate():
6101     # test that _broadcast_concatenate properly broadcasts arrays along all
6102     # axes except `axis`, then concatenates along axis
6103     np.random.seed(0)
6104     a = np.random.rand(5, 4, 4, 3, 1, 6)
6105     b = np.random.rand(4, 1, 8, 2, 6)
6106     c = _broadcast_concatenate((a, b), axis=-3)
6107     # broadcast manually as an independent check
6108     a = np.tile(a, (1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 1))
6109     b = np.tile(b[None, ...], (5, 1, 4, 1, 1, 1))
6110     for index in product(*(range(i) for i in c.shape)):
6111         i, j, k, l, m, n = index
6112         if l < a.shape[-3]:
6113             assert a[i, j, k, l, m, n] == c[i, j, k, l, m, n]
6114         else:
6115             assert b[i, j, k, l - a.shape[-3], m, n] == c[i, j, k, l, m, n]
6116 
6117 
6118 @array_api_compatible
6119 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6120                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6121 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6122 def test_ttest_ind_with_uneq_var(xp):
6123     # check vs. R `t.test`, e.g.
6124     # options(digits=20)
6125     # a = c(1., 2., 3.)
6126     # b = c(1.1, 2.9, 4.2)
6127     # t.test(a, b, equal.var=FALSE)
6128 
6129     a = xp.asarray([1., 2., 3.])
6130     b = xp.asarray([1.1, 2.9, 4.2])
6131     pr = xp.asarray(0.53619490753126686)
6132     tr = xp.asarray(-0.686495127355726265)
6133 
6134     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, equal_var=False)
6135     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6136     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6137 
6138     t, p = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(a, b), equal_var=False)
6139     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6140     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6141 
6142     a = xp.asarray([1., 2., 3., 4.])
6143     pr = xp.asarray(0.84354139131608252)
6144     tr = xp.asarray(-0.210866331595072315)
6145 
6146     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, equal_var=False)
6147     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6148     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6149 
6150     t, p = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(a, b), equal_var=False)
6151     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6152     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6153 
6154     # regression test
6155     tr = xp.asarray(1.0912746897927283)
6156     tr_uneq_n = xp.asarray(0.66745638708050492)
6157     pr = xp.asarray(0.27647831993021388)
6158     pr_uneq_n = xp.asarray(0.50873585065616544)
6159     tr_2D = xp.asarray([tr, -tr])
6160     pr_2D = xp.asarray([pr, pr])
6161 
6162     rvs3 = xp.linspace(1, 100, 25)
6163     rvs2 = xp.linspace(1, 100, 100)
6164     rvs1 = xp.linspace(5, 105, 100)
6165     rvs1_2D = xp.stack([rvs1, rvs2])
6166     rvs2_2D = xp.stack([rvs2, rvs1])
6167 
6168     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs2, axis=0, equal_var=False)
6169     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6170     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6171 
6172     t, p = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1, rvs2), equal_var=False)
6173     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6174     xp_assert_close(p, pr)
6175 
6176     t, p = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1, rvs3, axis=0, equal_var=False)
6177     xp_assert_close(t, tr_uneq_n)
6178     xp_assert_close(p, pr_uneq_n)
6179 
6180     t, p = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*_desc_stats(rvs1, rvs3), equal_var=False)
6181     xp_assert_close(t, tr_uneq_n)
6182     xp_assert_close(p, pr_uneq_n)
6183 
6184     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T, axis=0, equal_var=False)
6185     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
6186     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
6187 
6188     args = _desc_stats(rvs1_2D.T, rvs2_2D.T)
6189     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*args, equal_var=False)
6190     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
6191     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
6192 
6193     res = stats.ttest_ind(rvs1_2D, rvs2_2D, axis=1, equal_var=False)
6194     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
6195     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
6196 
6197     args = _desc_stats(rvs1_2D, rvs2_2D, axis=1)
6198     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(*args, equal_var=False)
6199     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, tr_2D)
6200     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, pr_2D)
6201 
6202 
6203 @array_api_compatible
6204 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6205                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6206 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6207 def test_ttest_ind_zero_division(xp):
6208     # test zero division problem
6209     x = xp.zeros(3)
6210     y = xp.ones(3)
6211     with pytest.warns(RuntimeWarning, match="Precision loss occurred"):
6212         t, p = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, equal_var=False)
6213     xp_assert_equal(t, xp.asarray(-xp.inf))
6214     xp_assert_equal(p, xp.asarray(0.))
6215 
6216     with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
6217         t, p = stats.ttest_ind(x, x, equal_var=False)
6218         xp_assert_equal(t, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6219         xp_assert_equal(p, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6220 
6221         # check that nan in input array result in nan output
6222         anan = xp.asarray([[1, xp.nan], [-1, 1]])
6223         t, p = stats.ttest_ind(anan, xp.zeros((2, 2)), equal_var=False)
6224         xp_assert_equal(t, xp.asarray([0., np.nan]))
6225         xp_assert_equal(p, xp.asarray([1., np.nan]))
6226 
6227 
6228 def test_ttest_ind_nan_2nd_arg():
6229     # regression test for gh-6134: nans in the second arg were not handled
6230     x = [np.nan, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0]
6231     y = [1.0, 2.0, 1.0, 2.0]
6232 
6233     r1 = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, nan_policy='omit')
6234     r2 = stats.ttest_ind(y, x, nan_policy='omit')
6235     assert_allclose(r2.statistic, -r1.statistic, atol=1e-15)
6236     assert_allclose(r2.pvalue, r1.pvalue, atol=1e-15)
6237 
6238     # NB: arguments are not paired when NaNs are dropped
6239     r3 = stats.ttest_ind(y, x[1:])
6240     assert_allclose(r2, r3, atol=1e-15)
6241 
6242     # .. and this is consistent with R. R code:
6243     # x = c(NA, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0)
6244     # y = c(1.0, 2.0, 1.0, 2.0)
6245     # t.test(x, y, var.equal=TRUE)
6246     assert_allclose(r2, (-2.5354627641855498, 0.052181400457057901),
6247                     atol=1e-15)
6248 
6249 
6250 @array_api_compatible
6251 def test_ttest_ind_empty_1d_returns_nan(xp):
6252     # Two empty inputs should return a TtestResult containing nan
6253     # for both values.
6254     if is_numpy(xp):
6255         with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
6256             res = stats.ttest_ind(xp.asarray([]), xp.asarray([]))
6257     else:
6258         res = stats.ttest_ind(xp.asarray([]), xp.asarray([]))
6259     assert isinstance(res, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
6260     NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)[()]
6261     xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6262     xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6263 
6264 
6265 @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6266 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6267 @array_api_compatible
6268 @pytest.mark.parametrize('b, expected_shape',
6269                          [(np.empty((1, 5, 0)), (3, 5)),
6270                           (np.empty((1, 0, 0)), (3, 0))])
6271 def test_ttest_ind_axis_size_zero(b, expected_shape, xp):
6272     # In this test, the length of the axis dimension is zero.
6273     # The results should be arrays containing nan with shape
6274     # given by the broadcast nonaxis dimensions.
6275     a = xp.empty((3, 1, 0))
6276     b = xp.asarray(b)
6277     with np.testing.suppress_warnings() as sup:
6278         # first case should warn, second shouldn't?
6279         sup.filter(SmallSampleWarning, too_small_nd_not_omit)
6280         res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, axis=-1)
6281     assert isinstance(res, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
6282     expected_value = xp.full(expected_shape, fill_value=xp.nan)
6283     xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, expected_value)
6284     xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, expected_value)
6285 
6286 
6287 @array_api_compatible
6288 def test_ttest_ind_nonaxis_size_zero(xp):
6289     # In this test, the length of the axis dimension is nonzero,
6290     # but one of the nonaxis dimensions has length 0.  Check that
6291     # we still get the correctly broadcast shape, which is (5, 0)
6292     # in this case.
6293     a = xp.empty((1, 8, 0))
6294     b = xp.empty((5, 8, 1))
6295     res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, axis=1)
6296     assert isinstance(res, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
6297     assert res.statistic.shape ==(5, 0)
6298     assert res.pvalue.shape == (5, 0)
6299 
6300 
6301 @array_api_compatible
6302 def test_ttest_ind_nonaxis_size_zero_different_lengths(xp):
6303     # In this test, the length of the axis dimension is nonzero,
6304     # and that size is different in the two inputs,
6305     # and one of the nonaxis dimensions has length 0.  Check that
6306     # we still get the correctly broadcast shape, which is (5, 0)
6307     # in this case.
6308     a = xp.empty((1, 7, 0))
6309     b = xp.empty((5, 8, 1))
6310     res = stats.ttest_ind(a, b, axis=1)
6311     assert isinstance(res, stats._stats_py.TtestResult)
6312     assert res.statistic.shape ==(5, 0)
6313     assert res.pvalue.shape == (5, 0)
6314 
6315 
6316 @array_api_compatible
6317 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(np_only=True,
6318                               reason="Other backends don't like integers")
6319 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6320 def test_gh5686(xp):
6321     mean1, mean2 = xp.asarray([1, 2]), xp.asarray([3, 4])
6322     std1, std2 = xp.asarray([5, 3]), xp.asarray([4, 5])
6323     nobs1, nobs2 = xp.asarray([130, 140]), xp.asarray([100, 150])
6324     # This will raise a TypeError unless gh-5686 is fixed.
6325     stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(mean1, std1, nobs1, mean2, std2, nobs2)
6326 
6327 
6328 @array_api_compatible
6329 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6330                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6331 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6332 def test_ttest_ind_from_stats_inputs_zero(xp):
6333     # Regression test for gh-6409.
6334     zero = xp.asarray(0.)
6335     six = xp.asarray(6.)
6336     NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
6337     res = stats.ttest_ind_from_stats(zero, zero, six, zero, zero, six, equal_var=False)
6338     xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6339     xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6340 
6341 
6342 @array_api_compatible
6343 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6344                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6345 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6346 def test_ttest_uniform_pvalues(xp):
6347     # test that p-values are uniformly distributed under the null hypothesis
6348     rng = np.random.default_rng(246834602926842)
6349     x = xp.asarray(rng.normal(size=(10000, 2)))
6350     y = xp.asarray(rng.normal(size=(10000, 1)))
6351     q = rng.uniform(size=100)
6352 
6353     res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, equal_var=True, axis=-1)
6354     pvalue = np.asarray(res.pvalue)
6355     assert stats.ks_1samp(pvalue, stats.uniform().cdf).pvalue > 0.1
6356     assert_allclose(np.quantile(pvalue, q), q, atol=1e-2)
6357 
6358     res = stats.ttest_ind(y, x, equal_var=True, axis=-1)
6359     pvalue = np.asarray(res.pvalue)
6360     assert stats.ks_1samp(pvalue, stats.uniform().cdf).pvalue > 0.1
6361     assert_allclose(np.quantile(pvalue, q), q, atol=1e-2)
6362 
6363     # reference values from R:
6364     # options(digits=16)
6365     # t.test(c(2, 3, 5), c(1.5), var.equal=TRUE)
6366     x, y = xp.asarray([2, 3, 5]), xp.asarray([1.5])
6367 
6368     res = stats.ttest_ind(x, y, equal_var=True)
6369     rtol = 1e-6 if is_torch(xp) else 1e-10
6370     xp_assert_close(res.statistic, xp.asarray(1.0394023007754), rtol=rtol)
6371     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, xp.asarray(0.407779907736), rtol=rtol)
6372 
6373 
6374 def _convert_pvalue_alternative(t, p, alt, xp):
6375     # test alternative parameter
6376     # Convert from two-sided p-values to one sided using T result data.
6377     less = xp.asarray(alt == "less")
6378     greater = xp.asarray(alt == "greater")
6379     i = ((t < 0) & less) | ((t > 0) & greater)
6380     return xp.where(i, p/2, 1 - p/2)
6381 
6382 
6383 @pytest.mark.slow
6384 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6385                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6386 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6387 @array_api_compatible
6388 def test_ttest_1samp_new(xp):
6389     n1, n2, n3 = (10, 15, 20)
6390     rvn1 = stats.norm.rvs(loc=5, scale=10, size=(n1, n2, n3))
6391     rvn1 = xp.asarray(rvn1)
6392 
6393     # check multidimensional array and correct axis handling
6394     # deterministic rvn1 and rvn2 would be better as in test_ttest_rel
6395     popmean = xp.ones((1, n2, n3))
6396     t1, p1 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, popmean, axis=0)
6397     t2, p2 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, 1., axis=0)
6398     t3, p3 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, 0, 0], 1.)
6399     xp_assert_close(t1, t2, rtol=1e-14)
6400     xp_assert_close(t1[0, 0], t3, rtol=1e-14)
6401     assert_equal(t1.shape, (n2, n3))
6402 
6403     popmean = xp.ones((n1, 1, n3))
6404     t1, p1 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, popmean, axis=1)
6405     t2, p2 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, 1., axis=1)
6406     t3, p3 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[0, :, 0], 1.)
6407     xp_assert_close(t1, t2, rtol=1e-14)
6408     xp_assert_close(t1[0, 0], t3, rtol=1e-14)
6409     assert_equal(t1.shape, (n1, n3))
6410 
6411     popmean = xp.ones((n1, n2, 1))
6412     t1, p1 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, popmean, axis=2)
6413     t2, p2 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1, 1., axis=2)
6414     t3, p3 = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[0, 0, :], 1.)
6415     xp_assert_close(t1, t2, rtol=1e-14)
6416     xp_assert_close(t1[0, 0], t3, rtol=1e-14)
6417     assert_equal(t1.shape, (n1, n2))
6418 
6419     # test zero division problem
6420     t, p = stats.ttest_1samp(xp.asarray([0., 0., 0.]), 1.)
6421     xp_assert_equal(xp.abs(t), xp.asarray(xp.inf))
6422     xp_assert_equal(p, xp.asarray(0.))
6423 
6424     tr, pr = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1.)
6425 
6426     t, p = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1., alternative="greater")
6427     pc = _convert_pvalue_alternative(tr, pr, "greater", xp)
6428     xp_assert_close(p, pc)
6429     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6430 
6431     t, p = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1., alternative="less")
6432     pc = _convert_pvalue_alternative(tr, pr, "less", xp)
6433     xp_assert_close(p, pc)
6434     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6435 
6436     with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
6437         res = stats.ttest_1samp(xp.asarray([0., 0., 0.]), 0.)
6438         xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6439         xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6440 
6441         # check that nan in input array result in nan output
6442         anan = xp.asarray([[1., np.nan], [-1., 1.]])
6443         res = stats.ttest_1samp(anan, 0.)
6444         xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, xp.asarray([0., xp.nan]))
6445         xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, xp.asarray([1., xp.nan]))
6446 
6447 
6448 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(np_only=True,
6449                               reason="Only NumPy has nan_policy='omit' for now")
6450 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6451 @array_api_compatible
6452 def test_ttest_1samp_new_omit(xp):
6453     n1, n2, n3 = (5, 10, 15)
6454     rvn1 = stats.norm.rvs(loc=5, scale=10, size=(n1, n2, n3))
6455     rvn1 = xp.asarray(rvn1)
6456 
6457     rvn1[0:2, 1:3, 4:8] = xp.nan
6458 
6459     tr, pr = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1., nan_policy='omit')
6460 
6461     t, p = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1., nan_policy='omit',
6462                              alternative="greater")
6463     pc = _convert_pvalue_alternative(tr, pr, "greater", xp)
6464     xp_assert_close(p, pc)
6465     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6466 
6467     t, p = stats.ttest_1samp(rvn1[:, :, :], 1., nan_policy='omit',
6468                              alternative="less")
6469     pc = _convert_pvalue_alternative(tr, pr, "less", xp)
6470     xp_assert_close(p, pc)
6471     xp_assert_close(t, tr)
6472 
6473 
6474 @pytest.mark.skip_xp_backends(cpu_only=True,
6475                               reason='Uses NumPy for pvalue, CI')
6476 @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6477 @array_api_compatible
6478 def test_ttest_1samp_popmean_array(xp):
6479     # when popmean.shape[axis] != 1, raise an error
6480     # if the user wants to test multiple null hypotheses simultaneously,
6481     # use standard broadcasting rules
6482     rng = np.random.default_rng(2913300596553337193)
6483     x = rng.random(size=(1, 15, 20))
6484     x = xp.asarray(x)
6485 
6486     message = r"`popmean.shape\[axis\]` must equal 1."
6487     popmean = xp.asarray(rng.random(size=(5, 2, 20)))
6488     with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6489         stats.ttest_1samp(x, popmean=popmean, axis=-2)
6490 
6491     popmean = xp.asarray(rng.random(size=(5, 1, 20)))
6492     res = stats.ttest_1samp(x, popmean=popmean, axis=-2)
6493     assert res.statistic.shape == (5, 20)
6494 
6495     xp_test = array_namespace(x)  # torch needs expand_dims
6496     l, u = res.confidence_interval()
6497     l = xp_test.expand_dims(l, axis=-2)
6498     u = xp_test.expand_dims(u, axis=-2)
6499 
6500     res = stats.ttest_1samp(x, popmean=l, axis=-2)
6501     ref = xp.broadcast_to(xp.asarray(0.05, dtype=xp.float64), res.pvalue.shape)
6502     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, ref)
6503 
6504     res = stats.ttest_1samp(x, popmean=u, axis=-2)
6505     xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, ref)
6506 
6507 
6508 class TestDescribe:
6509     @array_api_compatible
6510     def test_describe_scalar(self, xp):
6511         with suppress_warnings() as sup, \
6512               np.errstate(invalid="ignore", divide="ignore"):
6513             sup.filter(RuntimeWarning, "Degrees of freedom <= 0 for slice")
6514             n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(xp.asarray(4.)[()])
6515         assert n == 1
6516         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], xp.asarray(4.0))
6517         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], xp.asarray(4.0))
6518         xp_assert_equal(m, xp.asarray(4.0))
6519         xp_assert_equal(v ,xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6520         xp_assert_equal(sk, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6521         xp_assert_equal(kurt, xp.asarray(xp.nan))
6522 
6523     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6524     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6525     @array_api_compatible
6526     def test_describe_numbers(self, xp):
6527         xp_test = array_namespace(xp.asarray(1.))  # numpy needs `concat`
6528         x = xp_test.concat((xp.ones((3, 4)), xp.full((2, 4), 2.)))
6529         nc = 5
6530         mmc = (xp.asarray([1., 1., 1., 1.]), xp.asarray([2., 2., 2., 2.]))
6531         mc = xp.asarray([1.4, 1.4, 1.4, 1.4])
6532         vc = xp.asarray([0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3])
6533         skc = xp.asarray([0.40824829046386357] * 4)
6534         kurtc = xp.asarray([-1.833333333333333] * 4)
6535         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x)
6536         assert n == nc
6537         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], mmc[0])
6538         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], mmc[1])
6539         xp_assert_close(m, mc, rtol=4 * xp.finfo(m.dtype).eps)
6540         xp_assert_close(v, vc, rtol=4 * xp.finfo(m.dtype).eps)
6541         xp_assert_close(sk, skc)
6542         xp_assert_close(kurt, kurtc)
6543 
6544         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x.T, axis=1)
6545         assert n == nc
6546         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], mmc[0])
6547         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], mmc[1])
6548         xp_assert_close(m, mc, rtol=4 * xp.finfo(m.dtype).eps)
6549         xp_assert_close(v, vc, rtol=4 * xp.finfo(m.dtype).eps)
6550         xp_assert_close(sk, skc)
6551         xp_assert_close(kurt, kurtc)
6552 
6553     def describe_nan_policy_omit_test(self):
6554         x = np.arange(10.)
6555         x[9] = np.nan
6556 
6557         nc, mmc = (9, (0.0, 8.0))
6558         mc = 4.0
6559         vc = 7.5
6560         skc = 0.0
6561         kurtc = -1.2300000000000002
6562         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x, nan_policy='omit')
6563         assert_equal(n, nc)
6564         assert_equal(mm, mmc)
6565         assert_equal(m, mc)
6566         assert_equal(v, vc)
6567         assert_array_almost_equal(sk, skc)
6568         assert_array_almost_equal(kurt, kurtc, decimal=13)
6569 
6570     @array_api_compatible
6571     def test_describe_nan_policy_other(self, xp):
6572         x = xp.arange(10.)
6573         x = xp.where(x==9, xp.asarray(xp.nan), x)
6574 
6575         message = 'The input contains nan values'
6576         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6577             stats.describe(x, nan_policy='raise')
6578 
6579         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x, nan_policy='propagate')
6580         ref = xp.asarray(xp.nan)[()]
6581         assert n == 10
6582         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], ref)
6583         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], ref)
6584         xp_assert_equal(m, ref)
6585         xp_assert_equal(v, ref)
6586         xp_assert_equal(sk, ref)
6587         xp_assert_equal(kurt, ref)
6588 
6589         if is_numpy(xp):
6590             self.describe_nan_policy_omit_test()
6591         else:
6592             message = "`nan_policy='omit' is incompatible with non-NumPy arrays."
6593             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6594                 stats.describe(x, nan_policy='omit')
6595 
6596         message = 'nan_policy must be one of...'
6597         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6598             stats.describe(x, nan_policy='foobar')
6599 
6600     def test_describe_result_attributes(self):
6601         # some result attributes are tuples, which aren't meant to be compared
6602         # with `xp_assert_close`
6603         actual = stats.describe(np.arange(5.))
6604         attributes = ('nobs', 'minmax', 'mean', 'variance', 'skewness', 'kurtosis')
6605         check_named_results(actual, attributes)
6606 
6607     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6608     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6609     @array_api_compatible
6610     def test_describe_ddof(self, xp):
6611         xp_test = array_namespace(xp.asarray(1.))  # numpy needs `concat`
6612         x = xp_test.concat((xp.ones((3, 4)), xp.full((2, 4), 2.)))
6613         nc = 5
6614         mmc = (xp.asarray([1., 1., 1., 1.]), xp.asarray([2., 2., 2., 2.]))
6615         mc = xp.asarray([1.4, 1.4, 1.4, 1.4])
6616         vc = xp.asarray([0.24, 0.24, 0.24, 0.24])
6617         skc = xp.asarray([0.40824829046386357] * 4)
6618         kurtc = xp.asarray([-1.833333333333333] * 4)
6619         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x, ddof=0)
6620         assert n == nc
6621         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], mmc[0])
6622         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], mmc[1])
6623         xp_assert_close(m, mc)
6624         xp_assert_close(v, vc)
6625         xp_assert_close(sk, skc)
6626         xp_assert_close(kurt, kurtc)
6627 
6628     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6629     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6630     @array_api_compatible
6631     def test_describe_axis_none(self, xp):
6632         xp_test = array_namespace(xp.asarray(1.))  # numpy needs `concat`
6633         x = xp_test.concat((xp.ones((3, 4)), xp.full((2, 4), 2.)))
6634 
6635         # expected values
6636         nc = 20
6637         mmc = (xp.asarray(1.0), xp.asarray(2.0))
6638         mc = xp.asarray(1.3999999999999999)
6639         vc = xp.asarray(0.25263157894736848)
6640         skc = xp.asarray(0.4082482904638634)
6641         kurtc = xp.asarray(-1.8333333333333333)
6642 
6643         # actual values
6644         n, mm, m, v, sk, kurt = stats.describe(x, axis=None)
6645 
6646         assert n == nc
6647         xp_assert_equal(mm[0], mmc[0])
6648         xp_assert_equal(mm[1], mmc[1])
6649         xp_assert_close(m, mc)
6650         xp_assert_close(v, vc)
6651         xp_assert_close(sk, skc)
6652         xp_assert_close(kurt, kurtc)
6653 
6654     @array_api_compatible
6655     def test_describe_empty(self, xp):
6656         message = "The input must not be empty."
6657         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6658             stats.describe(xp.asarray([]))
6659 
6660 
6661 @array_api_compatible
6662 class NormalityTests:
6663     def test_too_small(self, xp):
6664         # 1D sample has too few observations -> warning/error
6665         test_fun = getattr(stats, self.test_name)
6666         x = xp.asarray(4.)
6667         if is_numpy(xp):
6668             with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
6669                 res = test_fun(x)
6670                 NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
6671                 xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6672                 xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6673         else:
6674             message = "...requires at least..."
6675             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6676                 test_fun(x)
6677 
6678     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6679     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6680     @pytest.mark.parametrize("alternative", ['two-sided', 'less', 'greater'])
6681     def test_against_R(self, alternative, xp):
6682         # testa against R `dagoTest` from package `fBasics`
6683         # library(fBasics)
6684         # options(digits=16)
6685         # x = c(-2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3)**2
6686         # x = rep(x, times=4)
6687         # test_result <- dagoTest(x)
6688         # test_result@test$statistic
6689         # test_result@test$p.value
6690         test_name = self.test_name
6691         test_fun = getattr(stats, test_name)
6692         ref_statistic= xp.asarray(self.case_ref[0])
6693         ref_pvalue = xp.asarray(self.case_ref[1])
6694 
6695         kwargs = {}
6696         if alternative in {'less', 'greater'}:
6697             if test_name in {'skewtest', 'kurtosistest'}:
6698                 ref_pvalue = ref_pvalue/2 if alternative == "less" else 1-ref_pvalue/2
6699                 ref_pvalue = 1-ref_pvalue if test_name == 'skewtest' else ref_pvalue
6700                 kwargs['alternative'] = alternative
6701             else:
6702                 pytest.skip('`alternative` not available for `normaltest`')
6703 
6704         x = xp.asarray((-2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3.)*4)**2
6705         res = test_fun(x, **kwargs)
6706         res_statistic, res_pvalue = res
6707         xp_assert_close(res_statistic, ref_statistic)
6708         xp_assert_close(res_pvalue, ref_pvalue)
6709         check_named_results(res, ('statistic', 'pvalue'), xp=xp)
6710 
6711     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6712     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6713     def test_nan(self, xp):
6714         # nan in input -> nan output (default nan_policy='propagate')
6715         test_fun = getattr(stats, self.test_name)
6716         x = xp.arange(30.)
6717         NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan, dtype=x.dtype)
6718         x = xp.where(x == 29, NaN, x)
6719         with np.errstate(invalid="ignore"):
6720             res = test_fun(x)
6721             xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6722             xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6723 
6724 class TestSkewTest(NormalityTests):
6725     test_name = 'skewtest'
6726     case_ref = (1.98078826090875881, 0.04761502382843208)  # statistic, pvalue
6727 
6728     def test_intuitive(self, xp):
6729         # intuitive tests; see gh-13549. skewnorm with parameter 1 has skew > 0
6730         a1 = stats.skewnorm.rvs(a=1, size=10000, random_state=123)
6731         a1_xp = xp.asarray(a1)
6732         pval = stats.skewtest(a1_xp, alternative='greater').pvalue
6733         xp_assert_close(pval, xp.asarray(0.0, dtype=a1_xp.dtype), atol=9e-6)
6734 
6735     def test_skewtest_too_few_observations(self, xp):
6736         # Regression test for ticket #1492.
6737         # skewtest requires at least 8 observations; 7 should raise a ValueError.
6738         stats.skewtest(xp.arange(8.0))
6739 
6740         x = xp.arange(7.0)
6741         if is_numpy(xp):
6742             with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
6743                 res = stats.skewtest(x)
6744                 NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
6745                 xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6746                 xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6747         else:
6748             message = "`skewtest` requires at least 8 observations"
6749             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6750                 stats.skewtest(x)
6751 
6752 
6753 class TestKurtosisTest(NormalityTests):
6754     test_name = 'kurtosistest'
6755     case_ref = (-0.01403734404759738, 0.98880018772590561)  # statistic, pvalue
6756 
6757     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6758     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6759     def test_intuitive(self, xp):
6760         # intuitive tests; see gh-13549. excess kurtosis of laplace is 3 > 0
6761         a2 = stats.laplace.rvs(size=10000, random_state=123)
6762         a2_xp = xp.asarray(a2)
6763         pval = stats.kurtosistest(a2_xp, alternative='greater').pvalue
6764         xp_assert_close(pval, xp.asarray(0.0, dtype=a2_xp.dtype), atol=1e-15)
6765 
6766     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6767     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6768     def test_gh9033_regression(self, xp):
6769         # regression test for issue gh-9033: x clearly non-normal but power of
6770         # negative denom needs to be handled correctly to reject normality
6771         counts = [128, 0, 58, 7, 0, 41, 16, 0, 0, 167]
6772         x = np.hstack([np.full(c, i) for i, c in enumerate(counts)])
6773         x = xp.asarray(x, dtype=xp.float64)
6774         assert stats.kurtosistest(x)[1] < 0.01
6775 
6776     @skip_xp_backends('cupy', reason='cupy/cupy#8391')
6777     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6778     def test_kurtosistest_too_few_observations(self, xp):
6779         # kurtosistest requires at least 5 observations; 4 should raise a ValueError.
6780         # At least 20 are needed to avoid warning
6781         # Regression test for ticket #1425.
6782         stats.kurtosistest(xp.arange(20.0))
6783 
6784         message = "`kurtosistest` p-value may be inaccurate..."
6785         with pytest.warns(UserWarning, match=message):
6786             stats.kurtosistest(xp.arange(5.0))
6787         with pytest.warns(UserWarning, match=message):
6788             stats.kurtosistest(xp.arange(19.0))
6789 
6790         x = xp.arange(4.0)
6791         if is_numpy(xp):
6792             with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
6793                 res = stats.skewtest(x)
6794                 NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
6795                 xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6796                 xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6797         else:
6798             message = "`kurtosistest` requires at least 5 observations"
6799             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6800                 stats.kurtosistest(x)
6801 
6802 
6803 class TestNormalTest(NormalityTests):
6804     test_name = 'normaltest'
6805     case_ref = (3.92371918158185551, 0.14059672529747502)  # statistic, pvalue
6806 
6807 
6808 class TestRankSums:
6809 
6810     np.random.seed(0)
6811     x, y = np.random.rand(2, 10)
6812 
6813     @pytest.mark.parametrize('alternative', ['less', 'greater', 'two-sided'])
6814     def test_ranksums_result_attributes(self, alternative):
6815         # ranksums pval = mannwhitneyu pval w/out continuity or tie correction
6816         res1 = stats.ranksums(self.x, self.y,
6817                               alternative=alternative).pvalue
6818         res2 = stats.mannwhitneyu(self.x, self.y, use_continuity=False,
6819                                   alternative=alternative).pvalue
6820         assert_allclose(res1, res2)
6821 
6822     def test_ranksums_named_results(self):
6823         res = stats.ranksums(self.x, self.y)
6824         check_named_results(res, ('statistic', 'pvalue'))
6825 
6826     def test_input_validation(self):
6827         with assert_raises(ValueError, match="`alternative` must be 'less'"):
6828             stats.ranksums(self.x, self.y, alternative='foobar')
6829 
6830 
6831 @array_api_compatible
6832 class TestJarqueBera:
6833     def test_jarque_bera_against_R(self, xp):
6834         # library(tseries)
6835         # options(digits=16)
6836         # x < - rnorm(5)
6837         # jarque.bera.test(x)
6838         x = [-0.160104223201523288,  1.131262000934478040, -0.001235254523709458,
6839              -0.776440091309490987, -2.072959999533182884]
6840         x = xp.asarray(x)
6841         ref = xp.asarray([0.17651605223752, 0.9155246169805])
6842         res = stats.jarque_bera(x)
6843         xp_assert_close(res.statistic, ref[0])
6844         xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, ref[1])
6845 
6846     @skip_xp_backends(np_only=True)
6847     @pytest.mark.usefixtures("skip_xp_backends")
6848     def test_jarque_bera_array_like(self):
6849         # array-like only relevant for NumPy
6850         np.random.seed(987654321)
6851         x = np.random.normal(0, 1, 100000)
6852 
6853         jb_test1 = JB1, p1 = stats.jarque_bera(list(x))
6854         jb_test2 = JB2, p2 = stats.jarque_bera(tuple(x))
6855         jb_test3 = JB3, p3 = stats.jarque_bera(x.reshape(2, 50000))
6856 
6857         assert JB1 == JB2 == JB3 == jb_test1.statistic == jb_test2.statistic == jb_test3.statistic  # noqa: E501
6858         assert p1 == p2 == p3 == jb_test1.pvalue == jb_test2.pvalue == jb_test3.pvalue
6859 
6860     def test_jarque_bera_size(self, xp):
6861         x = xp.asarray([])
6862         if is_numpy(xp):
6863             with pytest.warns(SmallSampleWarning, match=too_small_1d_not_omit):
6864                 res = stats.jarque_bera(x)
6865             NaN = xp.asarray(xp.nan)
6866             xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, NaN)
6867             xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, NaN)
6868         else:
6869             message = "At least one observation is required."
6870             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=message):
6871                 res = stats.jarque_bera(x)
6872 
6873     def test_axis(self, xp):
6874         rng = np.random.RandomState(seed=122398129)
6875         x = xp.asarray(rng.random(size=(2, 45)))
6876 
6877         res = stats.jarque_bera(x, axis=None)
6878         ref = stats.jarque_bera(xp.reshape(x, (-1,)))
6879         xp_assert_equal(res.statistic, ref.statistic)
6880         xp_assert_equal(res.pvalue, ref.pvalue)
6881 
6882         res = stats.jarque_bera(x, axis=1)
6883         s0, p0 = stats.jarque_bera(x[0, :])
6884         s1, p1 = stats.jarque_bera(x[1, :])
6885         xp_assert_close(res.statistic, xp.asarray([s0, s1]))
6886         xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, xp.asarray([p0, p1]))
6887 
6888         resT = stats.jarque_bera(x.T, axis=0)
6889         xp_assert_close(res.statistic, resT.statistic)
6890         xp_assert_close(res.pvalue, resT.pvalue)
6891 
6892 
6893 class TestMannWhitneyU:
6894     X = [19.8958398126694, 19.5452691647182, 19.0577309166425, 21.716543054589,
6895          20.3269502208702, 20.0009273294025, 19.3440043632957, 20.4216806548105,
6896          19.0649894736528, 18.7808043120398, 19.3680942943298, 19.4848044069953,
6897          20.7514611265663, 19.0894948874598, 19.4975522356628, 18.9971170734274,
6898          20.3239606288208, 20.6921298083835, 19.0724259532507, 18.9825187935021,
6899          19.5144462609601, 19.8256857844223, 20.5174677102032, 21.1122407995892,
6900          17.9490854922535, 18.2847521114727, 20.1072217648826, 18.6439891962179,
6901          20.4970638083542, 19.5567594734914]
6902 
6903     Y = [19.2790668029091, 16.993808441865, 18.5416338448258, 17.2634018833575,
6904          19.1577183624616, 18.5119655377495, 18.6068455037221, 18.8358343362655,
6905          19.0366413269742, 18.1135025515417, 19.2201873866958, 17.8344909022841,
